DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the extent or severity of organ involvement by lymphoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II --Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on same side of diaphragm or localized involvement of extralymphatic organ or site and one or more lymph node regions on same side of diaphragm
Stage I --Involvement of a single lymph node region or of a single extralymphatic organ or site
Stage III --involvement of lymph node regions on both sides of diaphragm, which may also be accompanied by localized involvement of extralymphatic organ or site, or the spleen, or both
Stage IV --Diffuse or disseminated involvement of one or more extralymphatic organs is tissues with or without associated lymph node enlargement
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003:A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2954522
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedDiagnosis > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedObservation > PerformedClinicalInterpretation.value WHERE PerformedDiagnosis.value = "Hodgkins Lymphoma" OR "Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma" AND PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess stage of disase" AND PerformedDiagnosis.resultClassificationCode = {specified organ involvement}
